A student of the KBTU Business School, Seysembekov Dulat Baurzhanuly, has won the prestigious international competition "Best Student of Turkic Nations," organized by the National Innovation Research Center of the Republic of Kazakhstan and the Academy of Best Students. This competition featured students from countries such as Kazakhstan, Turkey, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, and Azerbaijan. It aims to support active, motivated young people who significantly contribute to student life and the development of society.

We congratulate Dulat on his well-deserved victory and wish him further success, inspiration, and new heights! We are proud of our students' achievements and believe that their example will be a powerful inspiration for others!

h1: Admissions Campaign Kicks Off at KBTU: High Interest Marks the Start of Grant Week

body_blocks.text: Select your language

On July 13, 2025, the nationwide grant application week officially began in Kazakhstan. This period is a crucial opportunity for school and college graduates to submit documents and compete for state educational grants.Kazakh-British Technical University (KBTU), staying true to its tradition, was among the first universities to open its doors to prospective students. The university’s admissions office began operating at 8:30 AM - well before the national online systems were launched.

Applicants Lined Up Early in the MorningAccording to the KBTU admissions office, prospective students began gathering in front of the university as early as 7:00 AM. Seeing this level of interest, Secretary of the Admissions Committee Abdulahat Ismailov stated that they decided to start working ahead of schedule to accommodate the early arrivals.

Over 350 Applicants on the First DayOn the opening day alone, more than 350 applicants visited the university to submit their documents. The process follows a "one-stop-shop" format: applicants can complete all the necessary steps - registration, consultation, and document submission - in a single location. Individual consultations on programs and admissions rules are also provided.
Welcome Gifts for Early Birds
To mark the occasion, the first three applicants who submitted their documents were given branded gift sets from KBTU - a gesture that reflects the university’s personal approach to each applicant.
Digital Submission in Focus

KBTU developed its own online admissions platform, integrated with the national eGov.kz system, to streamline the process. According to Deputy Secretary of the Admissions Committee Asel Zhumaseitova, the majority of applicants are choosing the online format this year. This shift not only reduces waiting times but also makes the overall process more convenient.
KBTU - The Choice of Ambitious Applicants

KBTU is one of the leading technical universities in Kazakhstan. Its programs in IT, oil and gas engineering, finance, chemical technology, and business are especially popular. Students benefit not only from high-quality academic education but also from opportunities for internships, research, industry collaboration, and dual-degree programs with international universities.

The document submission process will continue throughout the week, in line with the official schedule of the Ministry of Science and Higher Education. KBTU has confirmed that its team is fully prepared to support applicants - both in person and online - ensuring a smooth, transparent, and applicant-friendly experience.

Kazakh-British Technical University is one of the leading technical universities in the region. We work in the partnership with the global academic community, corporate and public sectors on fundamental values ​​of quality, academic integrity, honesty, openness.
KBTU is the world level university engaged in scientific research, education and training of the scientific elite and highly qualified staff for various areas of global economy.

We are building a bridge of knowledge between society and science, between Kazakhstan and rest of the world in areas such as technology and business. We are confident in our strengths and capabilities, working with various interested parties. An innovative and creative approach is a priority for KBTU, our projects differ in concept and solve various problems.
KBTU’s dedication towards quality improvement, academic excellence is represented by participation of leading companies in KBTU Advisory Board.
Our faculty is represented by local and international faculty from countries like the UK, Australia, Turkey, USA, India, Russia.

More than 90% of KBTU graduates find jobs after graduation or they continue their studies on masters degree programs. The majority of our graduates work in the leading international oil and gas companies, consulting, IT companies in Kazakhstan and around the globe.
Some of the leading scientists in mathematics, physics are employed at KBTU.KBTU has modern facilities, scientific laboratories, where researchers and students work on innovative projects.

Internationalization is one of the priorities of KBTU's strategy. We have established partnerships and cooperation with the best world universities, such as the University of London, Harvard Business School, Kyoto Institute of Technology, Russian State University of Oil and Gas named after V.I. Gubkin, University of Reading, University of Northampton, Kozminski University and many others.

Over the past 5 years, there has been an increase in academic mobility for 6 times since 2015. Growth of the international students by 4 times in the same period from countries like Russia, Kyrgyzstan, China, Iran, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Uzbekistan and other countries.

Each year our university is presented in the international QS ranking. In the region of Central Asia and Eastern Europe, we are in the top 30% of universities, according to the global QS ranking, we are in the top 5 universities in Kazakhstan. KBTU programs had received international recognition through accreditations with ABET, ACBSP, IQAA, CIMA, ACCA, CFA.

h1: KBTU EXPANDS COLLABORATION WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF STAFFORDSHIRE (UK) IN IT, AI, CYBERSECURITY, AND GAME DEVELOPMENT

body_blocks.text: Select your language

On October 24, 2024, Kazakh-British Technical University (KBTU) strengthened its international academic partnerships by signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the University of Staffordshire, United Kingdom. This agreement includes collaboration across IT, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Cybersecurity, Games Development.
With campuses in Stoke-on-Trent, London and Stafford, the University of Staffordshire is well-regarded for its innovation and technology-focused programs, making it an ideal partner for KBTU.

As part of this collaboration, KBTU has shared detailed educational program plans with University of Staffordshire to ensure that academic credits (ECTS) and learning outcomes align across institutions. Subject to final approvals, this alignment enables KBTU students to transfer credits seamlessly and pursue either the final year of their degree or postgraduate study abroad.

This partnership underscores KBTU’s commitment to providing students with global educational and professional development opportunities, preparing them for leadership roles in an increasingly interconnected world.

h1: KBTU DELEGATES ENGAGED IN KING’S CLIMATE & SUSTAINABILITY NETWORKING EVENT

body_blocks.text: Select your language

Delegates from the Kazakhstan-British Technical University (KBTU), specifically from the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) Projects Department of the Academy of Corporate Education, recently attended the King’s Climate & Sustainability (KCS) Networking Event King's Climate & Sustainability | King's College London This gathering united members of the King’s community committed to climate action and sustainability across various disciplines in teaching and research.

The event centered on Education for Sustainability (EfS) at King’s, highlighting innovative efforts to integrate sustainability into the university’s curricula. KBTU representatives had the opportunity to connect with awardees of King’s Academy and the inaugural EfS Projects Fund (2023-24), engaging in insightful discussions about the challenges and successes faced in interdisciplinary collaborations.

Notably, through the support of the SDG Projects Department, KBTU master students will participate in the international Data Dive program at King’s. This initiative, funded by King’s, will provide students with the chance to showcase their skills, with the best project group advancing to the final competition in 2025. More information will be announced in www.sdg-center.kbtu.kz and registration link for internal communications will be provided in the web-site.

The event not only showcased ongoing projects but also marked the launch of the 2024-25 funding round, fostering new opportunities for collaboration and innovation in sustainability education. KBTU’s participation underscores its commitment to advancing sustainable practices in education and contributing to global sustainability goals.

The attendance of KBTU delegates was made possible with the information support of the King’s Alumni and invitation of EfS at Kings, highlighting the recognition of initiatives of SDG projects department to fostering sustainable development.

Second place went to Dana Tsoy for her innovative project, "VR Simulator for Angioplasty." Her development aims to create a virtual reality environment for medical professionals, allowing highly effective training for complex surgical procedures.

The knowledge and connections gained will help participants in their future professional endeavors, and the projects of the competition winners may soon become the basis for new successful startups.

In 2025 Kazakhstan will celebrate the 180th anniversary of the great poet, philosopher and national enlightener Abay Kunanbayev. In preparation for this significant event, KBTU Student Union students came up with an initiative to assign honorary names to social objects of KBTU infrastructure, reflecting the concept of "Tolyq Adam". This initiative, aimed at the preservation and development of Abay's spiritual heritage, was supported and approved by the decision of the Academic Council of KBTU JSC, which emphasizes its importance and relevance for the university community.

The students' initiative is not accidental and reflects a new wave of perception of Abay's heritage among the youth. The modern generation, living in conditions of rapid change, finds in the messages of the great thinker not only eternal truths, but also guidelines for personal and social development. In the context of global challenges, such as sustainable development, social justice and ESG-principles (Environmental, Social, and Governance), Abai's legacy acquires special significance, becoming an integral part of the educational process.

The world faces a multitude of challenges, from environmental crises to social justice issues. In this context, a change in thinking and a return to cultural roots become an urgent need. As noted by the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan Kasym-Jomart Tokayev in his article "Abay and Kazakhstan in the XXI century", Abay's concept of "perfect man" should become the basis for all spheres of life, including public administration, education, business and family relations. This emphasizes the importance of building quality human capital, which is a key factor in addressing modern challenges.

The Abai precept «Үш-ақ нәрсе — адамның қасиеті: ыстық қайрат, нұрлы ақыл, жылы жүрек...». - These are the three key qualities that the great thinker considered fundamental for a human being: diligence, honesty, inquisitive mind and kindness. These qualities, embodied in the concept of "Tolyk adam", are the basis for the formation of competencies of a modern young specialist capable of successfully operating in the conditions of global changes.

Now these values are reflected in KBTU's initiative, under which the university will soon have new infrastructure facilities: "YSTYQ QAIRAT Sports Complex", "NURLY AQYL Scientific Library" and "JYLY JÜREK Student Space". These names, inspired by the concept of "Tolyk Adam", symbolize not only a tribute to Abay's legacy, but also a desire to introduce his ideas into the modern educational environment.

The names of these facilities are not just symbols. They reflect the university's mission to educate a new generation of responsible and moral leaders. In conditions when people become the most important capital, only through the formation of "right people" with high moral and professional qualities, it is possible to ensure sustainable development of all spheres of the national economy. Universities, including KBTU, play a key role in this process, graduating specialists who can become the driving force of progress and prosperity of the country.

Thus, the initiative to assign honorary names to the KBTU infrastructure objects is an important step towards the implementation of Abay's ideas in the educational environment, aimed at the formation of future leaders who are able to act responsibly and effectively in the face of global challenges, remaining faithful to spiritual and moral values.

h1: KBTU EMPLOYEES HAVE COMPLETED AN INTENSIVE COURSE ACCORDING TO THE ISO 27001 STANDARD

body_blocks.text: Select your language

Employees of the Kazakhstan BTU (KBTU) completed an intensive course on the ISO 27001 standard, organized with the support of the world's leading educational centers - Janser Academy and TÜV Rheinland Academy in Germany. The training, which took place from April 26 to May 4, 2024, was an important step in establishing a sustainable approach to ensuring the university’s information security. This is the first group from Kazakhstan to successfully pass the international certification ISO 27001, accredited by TÜV Rheinland Academy in Germany.

This course was organized within the framework of the KBTU SDG Center by the KBTU Project Groups and with the support of the KBTU Department of Continuing Education. ISO 27001 is an international standard that defines the requirements for an information security management system, which will become a mandatory component for all universities in the Republic of Kazakhstan in the near future.

Course participants acquired not only theoretical knowledge of the principles and requirements of the ISO 27001 standard, but also practical skills in its implementation and maintenance, which will enable the university to strengthen its information security systems and increase its competitiveness in the educational sector. The staff and management of KBTU, as the best technical university in the country, confirmed their skills and their commitment to modern global challenges in the field of digitalization and security in IT. During passing the certification exam, Katja Kaiser, Director of the TUV Rheinland Accreditation Center, specially arrived to ensure transparency and compliance with the standards of the ISO27001 accreditation exam. In addition, this course will provide KBTU with the necessary knowledge and skills for the university to successfully pass accreditation and certification according to the ISO 27001 standard, and project work will also begin on its implementation in the university environment.
